title: People need to chill the hell out.
body:
Recently people are so angry and irritated and overall jerks in a lot of the games I play and see. I usually don't experience this because I'm in Bronze (Hell, I'm in Bronze for this reason, because of the nice people), but recently it's become a problem. And a recurring one at that. For example, one game I had...

>{{champion:27}} *is AFK at the beginning of the game*
{{champion:98}} Alright, be careful not to die.
{{champion:98}} We might have to remake.
{{champion:115}} stfu
{{champion:115}} he's reconnecting

Is it really warranted to be such a jerk to such a passive statement? I mean, jeez, calm down. Here's another one:

>{{champion:3}} /all gg this team is fucking garbo
{{champion:3}} /all Fuck this team
{{champion:64}} /all Dude your jungler camped your lane and you still lost...
{{champion:121}} /all ^
{{champion:3}} stfu Kha your fucking useless

Now, usually when I encounter people like this I just report and move on. But it's become concerning how status quo this attitude is becoming. In my past 15 games, 13 of them have had people like this. I've seen people in other videos adopting the same mentality. This behavior is not acceptable by any standard or in any case, and there are better ways to vent frustration (my favorite is singing a song about how stupid Vayne's damage is when she three shots me as a tank). 

Guys, if you're somebody who is like this in-game, just stop. It's not going to make people listen to you, it's not going to make you feel better in the long run, and it sure as hell isn't going to fix that losing streak. And most of all, it isn't going to make you a better person or a better player.

So, in short:
https://media.giphy.com/media/10QnBCa9QbQHiE/giphy.gif

replies.body: "Toxic behavior" comes from the "I'm gonna be Faker( or insert pro here)" mentality, which means they don't care about the over-all point of the game ( work together to obtain goals). This mentality is also the reason why we don't have more supports. Everyone wants to be the best, but many don't understand you still can be by being supportive ( weather you are in the support role or not). This "I am a god, all hail me" type of acting needs to stop, flaming does not help, it only brings down teammates and causes them to loose focus by having arguments in chat.

I cannot quite express just how accurate this is. And this is coming from a support main. (Or, at least, an in-training-to-be support main)

But, you are absolutely right about the "it only brings down teammates" part. Honestly, this is probably the most important part of why toxic players should simply stop being toxic. Their comments do nothing but distract their teammates. But then, if their teammate mutes them, they begin spamming "mia" pings all game. That is a problem for two reasons. One, it causes the teammate to lose focus for that moment since they'll initially believe that they are legit being warned about upcoming ganks/danger. And, two, it's just pure irritating and could tilt that player.

What I hate the most in toxic players is the fact that when they start getting tilted, instead of changing their playstyle from aggro-to-passive (or even passive-to-aggro, if that happens to be the problem), they just start flaming their team. Not even for what is happening in their own lane, but for things that their teammates are doing. (No matter whether it's good or bad.)

If their teammate does something good, the toxic player will say something along the lines of "Oh, finally this [insert champ name here] wants to be useful." Like, why even comment on someone else's 'usefulness' if you're doing poorly, yourself? You have no reason, nor right, to do so.

If their teammate does something bad, the toxic player will say something along the lines of "Oh my god, this f-ing [insert champ name here] is so garbage. Why are you even playing [insert role here]? You suck at it." All the while, that toxic player is still doing terribly, and most of the time, worse because their attention is now where it shouldn't be: on their team.

What makes all this worse is that I've been in a couple games where even the Support (during the rare times I don't get it) on my team, complains that the team isn't doing anything. Meanwhile that same support isn't warding, isn't healing (if applicable), isn't tanking properly (going in at inopportune times or just running from fights altogether), isn't shifting their kit over to anyone other than the adc at times where it'd be more beneficial for fights and such, etc. They just go to town in chat (all-chat, to be more specific) about how everyone else in the game is performing.

You mentioned the following:

"'Toxic behavior' comes from the 'I'm gonna be Faker( or insert pro here)' mentality...This "I am a god, all hail me" type of acting..."

This can actually be summed up with a quote from the movie "The Incredibles" where Syndrome stated:

"And when everyone's super. No one will be."

This is actually true to League's toxic players. They all believe they are the best and completely ignore the fact that League is a team game. When they feel like they aren't the best or more "Super" than another player, they flame. Because they truly believe flaming will force their competition to be less "Super". It's almost like a very quickly spreading disease, in my opinion.

This just happened to me in my ranked match. They kept spamming me with "?" pings on top of my character for every little thing i did. They got really toxic because after numerous times asking them to please stop spamming pings, I said that they would leave me no choice but to report them. I didnt want to report them but I had to because they just wouldnt fucking stop. Shit tilted me so hard that i went 1/9/5 on a champ and role that I'm really good at. Its very distracting and hard to focus when they do it over and over and over. Riot needs to address this issue ASAP

I definitely agree with you don't worry, but as a support main that attitude doesn't bother me at all. I learned how to deal with those players and still help the team without them hampering my will to play support. 

It's mostly just learning how to carry as a support and how to help your team that wants to cooperate to do their best. If you have 1 person on your team acting up with their God Mentality, then learn to support the other players who aren't being a jerk :P 

Granted, it doesn't work all the time, but it does help you mentally and helps your team respect you as a support when you learn to prioritize teammates and realize you aren't shackled to your ADC all game. 

Also, I like to play supports that either provide a lot of utility to the team, or can carry on their own via damage. I don't like letting 1 person hinder me or ruin my will to play support. 

And if supporting get's too tough, people can always try to jungle :P I feel jungling is like a global support with better carrying options. So the two work pretty well together.

Just my thoughts~ But I definitely agree with what you said.

The flame issue isn't about just supports though, these toxic players am at aim at any one not up to their expectations.

SupportMainLove tho!

But I was mostly just pointing out the issue of flame supports get when paired with a toxic ADC. There are plenty of ways to get around it while still carrying as a support. If anything, playing a support that can carry is fun because the enemy team doesn't expect it either. 

I just don't want people to fall victim and think they can't win when they're stuck with an asshole. There is always a way to win~

I just won a 4v5 yesterday where our jungler dc'd. We stayed positive (i was {{champion:99}} lol) and made shit happen. At the end of the game the enemy jungle wanted to friend request me, but then proceeded to shit on each of his teammates. I thought it was a perfect example of how attitude can displace a missing player. Positivity is OP.

The other team just sucked, badly.

When a team is missing a member you can very easily just split push them to death and there's not a thing they can do about it. Positive or not.

I'm Bronze so I'd have to say we all sucked. I'm sure these comebacks couldn't happen in Diamond. They did control the map though, I just warded our Red/Blue and caught Shaco when he came into our turf, ulted the dragon for a steal, got good support from {{champion:98}} when things got hairy, and {{champion:222}} was on the ball with the turret take downs. I suppose in higher elo this would be like a $10k stall & comeback. Mindset does effect the game, teamwork is OP.

The last 3-4 days, especially in Ranked Flex, people have been so toxic, that seriously it's my first time seeing people so on edge and cursing so much.
It's EVEN worse than the end of the season. I have been playing so many years and i never encountered SO MANY toxic people in such a small period of time.
Example: https://scontent-frt3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t34.0-12/15151469_10154693616003180_1159726609_n.jpg?oh=5581f31d9df7d6366baa6593b83e6ab0&oe=58356ADC

This has been LITERALLY every game these past days. Everyone is flaming, everyone is blaming and when you offer some advice nicely, you end up being told that you are so toxic, it's so absurd.

To everyone who's commented as well, you're focusing on the negative side of things just like everyone else does. The positive side is that where there's a problem there's a solution as long as you can control who you play with. 
Having played League for 7+ years now, I know the community has gotten less and less enjoyable to play with, but I also know for every 4th or 5th game that makes your hair fall out there's also one that you get the best experience's from which we play LoL for. It's like shooting up heroin, you want that beautiful moment you experienced the very first time you did it so you keep coming back expecting different results than the last 4 times you did it and maybe this'll be the time you get high again. Close to the definition of insanity.
Anyway, hold close to the people you enjoyed playing with, add them and find out what they enjoy playing and be willing to try new play styles. Every time you enjoyed playing with someone in solo queue or ARAM whatever it is, see if they want to queue again and soon enough you'll have enough friends to queue up with that the possibility of a troll being in your game is reduced greatly.

P.S. Don't run your new friends away with your acquired taste for trolls, you are what you eat.

I completely get the 1/5 is bound to be a good game concept and its not that we are saying "woe is me" while asking someone to smack us with a shovel. If you have no friends on at the time, are (for the most part) a loner, or new then we should not have to deal with your "issues" while we are doing our best to play.

I however do fall into insanity of sorts, playing with complete randomds is entertaining and knowing you defeated your opponent with people you may have never played with before is very satisfying. However this makes the people who flame just as insane as me though, we both went in on a chance.

Since its equally insane then, I still believe some "team like" conduct should be there! Right?
I rant often enough and actually give ways to solve the issue and never get any real feedback or promises to the future. Just curious how empty complaints are making anything better.

Well they may seem empty but our words are not just text. I personally hope everything written here has shed light for someone, maybe got a toxic player to think "hmm?", helped a tilted support or another role feel a tad better or something else. Life is about your perception of a situation, I perceive this as discussion on what is wrong and where the true source of our turmoil is coming from. Since this is a rational discussion and intelligent, I don't expect the masses to swarm and agree, but on the very slim chance that our words are helpful in any way then it has been time well spent.
Very well put.
Thank you, having these conversions is both fun and awesome!
